books.title: A Little Princess
books.author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
books.summary: A young girl discovers a life of unexpected challenges when she goes to live at a London boarding school.

books.title: Captain Blood
books.author: Rafael Sabatini
books.summary: An English doctor is caught up in a rebellion and sentenced to transportation to the Caribbean, but later escapes slavery to become a pirate.

books.title: The Autobiography of Ma-Ka-Tai-Me-She-Kia-Kiak, or Black Hawk
books.author: Black Hawk
books.summary: The autobiography of Black Hawk, the famous leader of the Native American Sauk tribe and central figure in the Black Hawk War of 1832.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: Driven Back to Eden
books.author: Edward Payson Roe
books.summary: A family leaves their crowded New York City flat to find health, happiness, and wholesome work in the countryside.

books.title: Mike
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A boy’s adventures in public school are filled with cricket, colorful characters, and a great deal of fun at the expense of authoritarian school masters.

books.title: Romeo and Juliet
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: The children of two opposing houses fall in love.

books.title: On a Pincushion
books.author: Mary De Morgan
books.summary: The first collection of fairy tales by Mary De Morgan.

books.title: Jeeves Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of short stories featuring Jeeves and Wooster and the upperclass English life of the early 1900s.

books.title: The Dark Other
books.author: Stanley G. Weinbaum
books.summary: A young woman seeks the reason behind her lover’s outbursts of cruelty.

books.title: Incidents in the Life of a Slave Girl
books.author: Linda Brent
books.summary: The autobiography of a woman who grew up in, and escaped from, slavery.

books.title: The Dain Curse
books.author: Dashiell Hammett
books.summary: A detective assigned to investigate a diamond theft finds himself entangled by a family curse.

books.title: Narrative of the Life of Frederick Douglass
books.author: Frederick Douglass
books.summary: Frederick Douglass describes his youth as a slave in Maryland and his desire to be a free man.

books.title: Essays
books.author: Thomas Paine
books.summary: A collection of Thomas Paine’s essays on republicanism, the problems of monarchy, and human rights.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Fernando Pessoa
books.summary: A collection of Fernando Pessoa’s poetry.

books.title: The Indiscreet Jewels
books.author: Denis Diderot
books.summary: The Sultan of the Congo brings about philosophical inquiry and scandal when he is granted a magical ring that permits him to compel speech from the vaginas of the women of his court.

books.title: Looking Backward
books.author: Edward Bellamy
books.summary: A man falls asleep in 1887 and wakes up over a century later in a socialist utopia.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Anton Chekhov
books.summary: A collection of Chekhov’s short stories and novellas ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Kingdom of God Is Within You
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: Tolstoy describes true Christianity as a non-hierarchical, nonviolent, non-coercive pursuit, and criticizes institutional Christianity as a deceptive corruption.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.
